# De Kadt & Wittels (2016): .red[reforms] + .violet[transition] = .green[good] result

```{r}

library(kableExtra)

tbl <- data.frame(
  Country = c("Mali", "Benin", "Ghana", "Senegal", 
              "Kenya", "Malawi", "Madagascar", "Tanzania", "Zambia"),
  Effect = c("Strongly positive", "Positive", "Positive", "Positive",
             "Null / negligible", "Null / negligible", "Negative", "Negative", "Strongly negative"),
  Magnitude = c("+42% annual", "Sizable gain", "Sizable gain", "Sizable gain",
                "≈ 0", "≈ 0", "Substantial loss", "Moderate loss", "−19% annual drop"),
  Interpretation = c("Early and aggresive institutional reforms",
                     "Peaceful transition, early reforms",
                     "Sustained growth following 1992 democratic consolidation",
                     "Incremental liberalization within stable institutions",
                     "Elections marred by fraud; little policy change",
                     "Limited institutional or policy shift",
                     "Political instability, weak institutions",
                     "Gradual liberalization; limited competition",
                     "Economic contraction, policy reversals, instability")
)

kbl(tbl)


```
